author: Joseph Otworth

text:
That's why I love the Tales series, every Fan has a different Favorite, yet every single installment is great....well except Legendia (the music was great though).

For me the best Tales game was Abyss. and then probably a tie between this one and Symphonia, with Vesperia following close behind.
author: Xzaithyr Grymhart

text: I actually didn't care much for this game - the voice acting ruined the characters for me, but at the same time... The side quests were brilliantly fun, and the world was amazing. It was certainly a great Tales experience, but not my favorite. That'll always be Phantasia's place to fill.

author: Phil Mante

text:
And the saddest thing? Maybe Vesperia was the last Tales game to be localized. They are not localizing Tales of Graces, and probably have too much MUSCLE MARCH to localize, anyway.

Stupid Namco-Bandai.
author: darkemg

text: We only got Tales of Destiny (PS1 game with SNES graphics; at least had the original voice acting), Eternia (very good, but crappy English voice acting and no skits), Legendia (crap of all crap), Symphonia (the best of the bunch, but no viced skits?), Abyss (good one, with extre goodies, but released 1 week before FF 12 with NO advertise and, again, NO VOICED SKITS) and Vesperia 360 (very good VA, very good game... but it is an incomplete version, of sorts).
author: darkemg

text: The sad thing is, Bandai-Namco is so busy bringing Naruto, Ben 10, Tekken and FREAKING MUSCLE MARCH here so they can't release the good Tales games (Destiny Remake, Destiny 2, Rebirth, Innocence, Vesperia PS3...). Hell, we didn't even get Phantasia (except the crappy GBA port).

text: I know this comment is 11 years old.  But the answer is yes. I think it has a way more coherent story line and a solid battle system that is simpler but better than Symphonias.  Also more interesting characters IMO.
